article.body: Axios political reporter Jonathan Swan has been covering Donald Trump for about five years now â and, as with anybody tasked with quoting the president, heâs heard some doozies. But Swan told MSNBC on Wednesday morning that his most recent interview with Trump was âone of the most shocking exchanges Iâve ever had with him.â And he wasnât talking about when Trump told him that âI read a lot. I comprehend extraordinarily well. Probably better than anybody that youâve interviewed in a long time.â Anyway, hereâs the full clip: div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } As far as the âshockingâ part, Swan was referring, specifically, to Trump claiming word of Russia supplying weapons and money to the Taliban never reached his desk, even though Gen. John Nicholson, former head of forces in Afghanistan, said as much on the record. Of course, there was a lot more to unpack than just that.
